LOUISVILLE HOTEL
REBUILT 1856, ENLARGED & REFURNISHED 1859.
KEAN STEELE & JUDGE
Proprietors.
Cor Sixth & Main Str.
LOUISVILLE KY.
Oct 19th 1864
Govnr Thomas E. Bramlett
Dear Sir

Our mutual friend Mr Berchatt informs me that when the State Troops leave his sexion of the County that it will be imposible to enforce civil law and in addition the lives of some of the best Citizens will be in great danger from outlaws I have recently visited that sexion of the County and am fully satisfied if the people are not protected that many of them will be compelled to leave the County allow me to suggest the propriety of ^Your^ stationing twenty five or thirty good & true men at Some Central point with orders to scout and protect the Citizens of Clinton Waine & Cumberland Counties
(over)
and afford assistance to the Sheriffs and other civil officers in arresting outlaws,, I hope youit will be in your power to comply with the wishes of your Friends.

Louisville, Oct. 19/65
Hobson Gen. E. H. To Gov.
Introducing Mr. Burchett, and stating that troops are necessary in Clinton county.
